title: Avengers' Chris Hemsworth far from Thor as he's roasted over backflip fail
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Avengers’ Chris Hemsworth has proven he can’t be in Thor mode all the time, after he managed to completely fail at a backflip.

Who needs backflips when you’re the god of thunder, right?

After an intense workout, the star cooled off in a stunning lake – although his friends brought the heat when they roasted him over the failed stunt.

‘What was that?’ one cried as he performed an awkward front spin, landing on his back, admitting ‘it hurt so much’.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Promising a backflip in another video, he carefully eyed out his path, before chucking himself backwards into the water, declaring the move ‘perfect!’

Always graceful, our Chris.

However, we can’t blame the lad too much as he also took on an intense workout with his pals, going for a sprint up a hill and then working on his biceps.

It all began so well (Picture: Chris Hemsworth/Instagram)

Because clearly they need it.

However, despite fans dreaming of having a body like the Men In Black star’s, they might be disappointed after Chris and his wife Elsa Pataky’s trainer Tahl Rinsky explained that it’s unlikely we’re ever going to look like them.

No need to let us down gently, then.

‘Most people if you set goals to change your body I think everyone can. But I don’t think everyone can look like Chris Hemsworth,’ she told Metro.co.uk.

He’s beauty and he’s grace (Picture: Chris Hemsworth/Instagram)

‘And do you want to look like Chris? First of all he’s six foot, he’s huge. If you’re five-foot-two you’re not going to look like Chris, you’re not going to grow!

‘We need to put things in perspective and draw inspiration from them. What they do beautifully, is they set goals and they work hard. They don’t laze around.’

We’ll leave the hard work to them TBH.

‘That hurt so much’ (Picture: Chris Hemsworth/Instagram)

Meanwhile, as if all the workouts weren’t enough, Chris has been fancying himself as a casting agent after he decided that he and his Avengers work husbands Robert Downey Jr (Tony Stark) and Chris Evans (Captain America) would make a cracking Three Amigos for the remake.

Plus, he’s after his brothers Liam and Luke joining him in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

You never know.
